|stockos = Linux;v2.4.20;3.2.3; (zacker@svn) (gcc version 3.2.3 with Broadcom modifications) #201; |exp_if_types = |exp_sim_num = |exp_pcmcia_num = |exp_expcard_num = |exp_minipci_num = |exp_minipcie_num = |exp_usb_num = |exp_cf_num = |exp_sdmmc_num = |exp_ide_num = |exp_ata_num = |exp_sata_num = |exp_esata_num = |exp_parallel = |exp_sfp_num = |exp_M.2 = |exp_hdmi_num = |usb_hub = |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 1 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = |jtag = |specialfeat = |flags = |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = bgn |defaulip = 192.168.1.1 |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = password |defaultssid = |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = |manuf = Foxconn |manuf_model = U12H114 |manuf_rev = |is_manuf = |tpfirmware = DD-WRT, OpenWrt, TomatoUSB |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 09/15/2009 |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |buttons = |led = |dimensions = 7" x 5.1" x 1.4" |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1cpu = true |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = U.FL |rad1txchains = 2 |rad1rxchains = 2 |rad1sstreams = 2 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 300 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 |rad1correv = |rad1cap = }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== Manuf. by Foxconn / Hon Hai / Ambit ==Links of Interest== *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=72269 On the DD-WRT forums] *[https://openwrt.org/toh/netgear/wnr2000 WNR2000 series on the OpenWrt wiki] ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing dd-wrt=== {{DDWRTNotice|k26req}} [https://forum.dd-wrt.com/wiki/index.php/Netgear_WNR2000V2 On the '''DD-WRT''' Wiki] Please insert instructions here darth_tater:
any of the file version i uploaded will work. you must start with the chk file. [ftp://dd-wrt.com/others/eko/V24-K26/svn14536/dd-wrt.v24-14536_NEWD-2_K2.6_mini-WNR2000v2.chk svn14536] from there, you can flash any image designed for routers with 4mb of flash memory. >LOM:
>>darth_tater wrote:
>>from there, you can flash any image designed for routers with 4mb of flash memory.
>
>
>No, see peacock thread paragraph 6 (if memory serves me).
>Netgear routers with their board_data partition in flash has slightly lower size limit than normal 4MB flash routers.
>Be careful not to use a too big sized build or you will overwrite your board_data and is then in for a long session of
>manual programming (see Dark_Shadow's thread about his WNDR3300 a week ago)
===Flashing OpenWrt=== {{OpenWrt |techdata = https://openwrt.org/toh/hwdata/netgear/netgear_wnr2000_v2 |wikipage = https://openwrt.org/toh/netgear/wnr2000 |forumpage = https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=18279 |forumpage2 = |forumpage3 = |github = |target = |subtarget = |arch = |support_started_version = ? |current_supported_version = 18.06.4 |comment = Unsupported Functions: WiFi 2.4GHz partly }} Please insert instructions here ===Flashing Tomato=== Please insert instructions here ==Upgrading== {{Upgrade dd-wrt}} ==Reverting== [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?p=483253#483253 On the '''DD-WRT''' Forum] [[Category:English Documentation]]
